summary: This document is email correspondence between an FBI forensic accountant and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding the preparation and service of subpoenas to USAA and American Express (AMEX) for financial records related to Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes an attached reimbursement form (OBD-211) for expenses related to the AMEX subpoena.

persons.name: G. Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoenas to USAA and AMEX are being prepared regarding her financial records.

events.title: Initial request for Maxwell subpoenas
events.description: An FBI agent sends an initial email requesting subpoenas for USAA and AMEX records regarding Ghislaine Maxwell, attaching subpoena riders.

events.title: Subpoenas prepared and form request
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney confirms the subpoenas are ready to serve, and an FBI agent requests a reimbursement form (OBD-211) for AMEX subpoena expenses.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
FBI New York Field Office, 26 Federal Plaza, NYC, NY 10278
keyFacts: Subpoenas were being prepared for USAA and American Express (AMEX) to obtain financial records related to Ghislaine Maxwell in December 2019.
The correspondence involves an FBI forensic accountant and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York coordinating the legal process.
An FBI agent specifically requested form OBD-211, a reimbursement of expenses form, related to the AMEX subpoena.
The document indicates an active financial investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell was underway at the time.
